results.title: Freedom to read
results.creator_credit: Center for Mass Communication of Columbia University, Erik Barnouw and Julian Roffman
results.brief_description: A discussion film dealing with the problem of censorship as it affects the public library. Dramatized incidents are used in presenting opposing points of view and in raising questions regarding the role of the Library in a democratic country.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Center for Mass Communication of Columbia University, Erik Barnouw and Julian Roffman

results.title: Freedom of the press
results.creator_credit: Affiliated Film Producers, Irving Jacoby and Alexander Hammid
results.brief_description: An historical review of freedom of the press in America from Zenger’s weekly journal to the publication of today’s newspapers. The film covers one news story (President Truman’s tax proposal) to metropolitan, small town and rural newspapers. Differentiates between news reporting and editorialising.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Affiliated Film Producers, Irving Jacoby and Alexander Hammid

results.title: Freedom is paradise = Ser swoboda eto rai
results.brief_description: Sasha Grigoriev, a 13 year old boy is an habitual escapee from the bleak reformatory in which he has been imprisoned. Sasha escapes, taking refuge with his aunt who hands him back to the authorities. There he accidentally discovers the whereabouts of his father who is serving a long prison sentence in a camp near the Arctic Circle.

results.title: Freedom from dust
results.brief_description: Surveys the problem of industrial air and water pollution, and the difficulties of effective waste disposal. Shows the instruments which are used to measure pollution in industrial areas, and the various possible measures to prevent or alleviate it.
results.description: Surveys the problem of industrial air and water pollution, and the difficulties of effective waste disposal. Shows the instruments which are used to measure pollution in industrial areas, and the various possible measures to prevent or alleviate it.

results.title: Free to roam
results.creator_credit: Strand Film Zoological Productions, Stuart Legg and Paul Burnford
results.brief_description: At Whipsnade Zoo, 35 miles from London, there is an unusual zoo; a great expanse of English downland is reserved for animals to roam as they do in their native habitats. To the reserve come naturalists and zoologists from many countries, for on these 500 acres of English soil, animal life from all over the world may be studied. The film makes use of interesting natural sound.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Strand Film Zoological Productions, Stuart Legg and Paul Burnford

results.title: Free to move (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Southern Films, Schools Council, Derek Monk, Ted Channell and Brian Lewis
results.brief_description: Attempts to show that physical education is concerned with the education of the whole child, not only his physical well being. Shows need for a broad based and varied programme of activities; and how related work in other areas of the curriculum may spring from or lead to work in movement. Presents a composite picture of the balanced programme offered in a good primary school.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Southern Films, Schools Council, Derek Monk, Ted Channell and Brian Lewis

results.title: Free to move
results.brief_description: This video is about friction: the resistance generated when one solid surface slides in contact with another. It is also about how we reduce the forces of friction by lubrication and how lubrication controls wear, to lengthen the life of the moving parts of machinery.
results.description: This video is about friction: the resistance generated when one solid surface slides in contact with another. It is also about how we reduce the forces of friction by lubrication and how lubrication controls wear, to lengthen the life of the moving parts of machinery.

results.title: Free to be, you and me
results.creator_credit: Murakami-Wolf Productions, Marlo Thomas, Carole Hart and Bill Davis
results.brief_description: A special program designed for a more structural approach to exploration of personal development concepts. Includes an all star cast from stage and screen, presenting in live action, animation and puppetry two thematically designed units: Friendship and co-operation; Expectations and independence. Features Alan Alda, Harry Belafonte, Mel Brooks, Rita Coolidge, Billy the Wolfe, Roberta Flack, Michael Jackson, Kris Kristofferson, Bobby Morse, The New Seekers, Tom Smothers, Cecily Tyson, The Voices ofo East Harlem and Dionne Warwick.
